comment.author: 55740338@N06
comment._content:
I believe that Radio Dot, is Dottie Mae, with whom Smokey Warren and his Mountain Dew Boys did live broadcasts from Palisades Park in the late 1960s over WJRZ Countrypolitan 97, which
was then located in Hackensack, New Jersey.  The host was Bob Lockwood.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minnie_Pearl Another early picture of Minnie Pearl www.lib.unc.edu/blogs/sfc/index.php/2010/08/06/photo-of-t... www.gettyimages.com/detail/73998803/Michael-Ochs-Archives has a bunch of early photos that could be in the same dress. And in the same hat -- although she clearly had lots of hats. The Getty Images photos are dated January 1, 1960, but that is clearly much too late -- likely a default date.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosalie_Allen www.westernmusic.org/performers/hof-allen-rosalie.html The UK's Independent gave her an obituary: www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/rosalie-allen-54892... Despite that level of fame, the Wikipedia article is pretty skimpy. www.venerablemusic.com/catalog/TitleDetails.asp?TitleID=1... has some sound clips of her hallmark yodeling.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: David Miller (in the suit was from WAAT, according to an article Gottlieb wrote about this, lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/loc.natlib.gottlieb.166/defaul... www.angelfire.com/nj2/piratejim/njamhistory4.html indicates that WAAT was based in Newark, NJ during the 1940s and Miller was a popular DJ.
